result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Salazar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Time Served Sentence with Credit for 2 days of prior time served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel Salazar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:26 PM: Defendant Miguel Salazar in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on SEH.  Def and counsel confirm State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea No DL 2:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by SPD. Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Advises Def that as a matter of law he cannot drive without a valid DL, no excceptions.  Impresses that fact on Def and penalties increase with each conviction.  Imposes 2 days WCJ with TS credit of 2 days - time served SEH; Court Costs with DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court - 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on April 22, 2016 at 02:05 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

ADDRESS INFO for Miguel Salazar
Current: 60 Pine Grove Villa, Bancroft, WI 54921 United States  (Effective: 03-08-2016)
Prior: PO Box 60, 42 Pine Grove Villa, Bancroft, WI 54921 United States
Defendant appears by video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 3:40 p.m. Defendant Miguel Salazar in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi. Atty Szilagyi appears telephonically. Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail. Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant issued for non appearance on 12/1/2015. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting a $200 Cash Bond. Court orders $200 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 02:05 pm.

Case Called @ 3:23 PM: Defendant Miguel Salazar not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cash Bond ordered forfeited.  Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
